result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael R Doro

records.addlTxt: Hearing on November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Letter dated 09/20/2022, filed by Atty Weitzner, requesting an adjournment of the 10/04/2022 Hearing

**Reviewed by Judge Carter on 09/22/2022 - Approved.**

3:17 PM Defendant Michael R Doro in court.  Attorney Cameron Weitzner in court for Michael R Doro. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

 Defense is in receipt of a pre-trial offer, and needs to discuss offer with charging DA and his client. There are some discovery issues that the Defense still needs to speak to the State about. Defense asks for a date in 30 days. 
State does not object. Court sets.
Hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on October 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.
From Wisconsin Community Services dated 08/15/22 indicating defendant has completed the case management and alcohol monitoring. Further is being removed from CAM and discharged from the program .
Laboratory report filed by the State.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

10:19 AM Defendant Michael R Doro in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Weitzner states he has discovery but does not have an offer yet. 

State files amended information. Defense waives reading and enters not-guilty plea on all counts. 

Court sets new date.  Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Hearing on July 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.

08:17 AM Defendant Michael R Doro in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
Court conducts a colloquy with the defendant as to waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.
  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.
State files information
Defense accepts receipt of the information, waives reading. 
  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing. filed by Cameron Weitzner
WCS enrollment
Preliminary hearing on June 22, 2022 at 08:15 am.

10:18 AM Defendant Michael R Doro in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Weitzner gives a status of defendant and requests a preliminary hearing.    Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Status conference on May 23, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Facility will provide proof that he is at the facility, a contact person at the facility, waivers are signed by the defendant, if defendant leaves the program WCS and the Court will be immediately notified of his release.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  


These conditions will be suspended until his is released from the facility.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols.  Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM.

08:19 AM Defendant Michael R Doro in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Weitzner moves for modify bail.  Victim rights have been complied with.  Atty. Sitzberger does not object and requests the agency to provide updates/violations.  Court adjourns preliminary hearing.  Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key. The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols.  Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.

02:27 PM Defendant Michael R Doro in court, in custody, with attorney Glenn Edward Gaskill.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.
